intro: Hermannia asbestina, commonly known as the asbestine strobilanthera, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy texture. Hermannia asbestina is typically found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
